ygData.subject: RE: possible big cheat for EQ....
ygData.msgSnippet: Nope, I have a Riva TNT and a matrox Mystique.  When I enable both monitors and play EQ, the second monitor is disabled for Alt-Tabs and such.  However, if you
ygData.messageBody:
Nope, I have a Riva TNT and a matrox Mystique. When I enable both monitors
and play EQ, the second monitor is disabled for Alt-Tabs and such. However,
if you move a program like Clock over to the second display, BEFORE you
start EQ, it does stay there during game play. But programs liek ICQ return
to the system tray on the primary display, and you can't see anything.

You also can't move your mouse to the second display. Depending of which
way to set your screen to stretch, you can't move beyond the boundaries of
the game during play.


-----Original Message-----
From: Francois B. [mailto:fkewl@...]

Subject: RE: [EQCheats] possible big cheat for EQ....


From: "Francois B." <fkewl@...>

I have an extra screen and video card. Ill install them on thursday and
give you a response on what it does.

System components:
Voodoo3 -- 17 inch monitor
S3 4meg -- 14 inch monitor (was with a 486!) (this is my extra)
P200 system on ASUS Tx97 board.
128 megs of ram

Neran GoldenLeaf
Xegony

----Original Message Follows----
From: "Omeg Felligan" <omeg_felligan@...>

I'm not sure about the program thing (to minimise), and I haven't tried the
2 monitors...I may be able to but I doubt it (I don't think any of my
friends would loan me a moniter for a game). Do you need a 2nd graphics
card for a 2nd moniter? I'm guessing you would need one in which case I
can't do it anyway b/c I have no open slots and my current card is bult into

the motherboard (darn Compaq).

About that program...what does Alt-Tab do? wouldn't it be just about the
same as a program sending the EQ window a command to minimise? in that case

the result would be the same (logging out, computer locking up mostly, etc).

But it might be different.

anyone have ideas?

Omeg
